title: Guest Post — Call for Feedback: STM Task & Finish Group (TFG) Image-type Taxonomy for Alt Text
content: Today's post calls for community feedback on STM's latest recommendations for alt-text metadata to support images in accessible scholarly publishing. The post Guest Post — Call for Feedback: STM Task & Finish Group (TFG) Image-type Taxonomy for Alt Text appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Lorna Notsch, Beth Richard
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post — AI Isn’t Going to Pay for Content … Part Two: The Path Forward
content: Today’s post paves a clear path forward in making AI work for publishers in the brave new agentic world. The post Guest Post — AI Isn’t Going to Pay for Content … Part Two: The Path Forward appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Jonathan Woahn
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Preliminary Evidence Linking Open Science to Research Integrity
content: Is open scholarship an honest signal of researcher integrity? We present preliminary evidence that data and code sharing, preprinting, and other open behaviors are indeed less common in papermill articles. The post Preliminary Evidence Linking Open Science to Research Integrity appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Tim Vines, Ben Kaube, Adam Day, Kristen Ratan
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Why Authors Aren’t Disclosing AI Use and What Publishers Should (Not) Do About It
content: Only a negligible percentage of authors seem to actually be disclosing their AI use. Here's why I think that's the case. The post Why Authors Aren’t Disclosing AI Use and What Publishers Should (Not) Do About It appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Avi Staiman
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Mental Health Awareness Mondays — The Courage to Be Uncertain: A New Approach to Impostor Feelings
content: Today's guest bloggers reflect on the experience of "imposter syndrome" and how we might adopt a new approach to moments of uncertainty and change. The post Mental Health Awareness Mondays — The Courage to Be Uncertain: A New Approach to Impostor Feelings appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
creator: Holly Koppel, Ashutosh Ghildiyal
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post – The Next Era of Reference Management: An Interview with William Gunn
content: Today's guest post features an interview with William Gunn discussing how AI will (or won't!) change the future of reference management tools. The post Guest Post – The Next Era of Reference Management: An Interview with William Gunn appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen .
